com.wowza.gocoder.sdk.api.devices

Class WZCameraView

  • java.lang.Object
    • SurfaceView
      • com.wowza.gocoder.sdk.api.devices.WZCameraView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    WZBroadcastAPI.AdaptiveBroadcaster, WZBroadcastAPI.Broadcaster, WZBroadcastAPI.VideoBroadcaster

    public class WZCameraView
extends SurfaceView
implements WZBroadcastAPI.VideoBroadcaster, WZBroadcastAPI.AdaptiveBroadcaster
    The WZCameraView class provides a custom View class for previewing the video captured from a camera device.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  WZCameraView.PreviewStatusListener
      Callback interface to use with setPreviewStatusListener(PreviewStatusListener)

      Constructor that is called when inflating a view from XML.

      Indicates if the camera preview display was paused due to the onPause method begin called

      Indicates if the camera preview has been fully initialized

      Called when the device configuration changes, typically to detect device orientation changes
      void onLowMemory()
      Called when the overall system is running low on memory, and actively running processes should trim their memory usage.
      void onPause()
      This method can be called from the activity's onPause() method to store the state of the camera preview display before the application is sent to the background.
      void onResume()
      This method can be used in conjunction with onPause() when called from the activity's onResume() method to restart the camera preview display based on the state it was in when the activity was paused and a corresponding call to onPause() was made.

      This method is called to initialize each component of a broadcast.

      • getPreviewStatus

        public WZStatus getPreviewStatus()
        Returns this view's preview status. When the camera preview is active, the status' state property will be WZState.RUNNING, or WZState.IDLE otherwise
        Returns:
        The camera preview display status

        public boolean isPreviewing()
        Indicates if the camera preview display is active This is equivalent to getPreviewStatus().isRunning() and getPreviewStatus().getState == WZState.RUNNING
        Returns:
        true if the camera preview is active, false otherwise

      • prepareForBroadcast

        public WZStatus prepareForBroadcast(WZBroadcastConfig broadcastConfig)
        Description copied from interface: WZBroadcastAPI.Broadcaster
        This method is called to initialize each component of a broadcast. Upon successful initialization, each component must set it's status to WZState.READY or WZState.IDLE and indicate the error in the status as well.
        Specified by:
        prepareForBroadcast in interface WZBroadcastAPI.Broadcaster
        Parameters:
        broadcastConfig - The broadcast configuration
        Returns:
        The overall status after transitioning each broadcast component to WZState.READY

      • startBroadcasting

        public WZStatus startBroadcasting()
        Description copied from interface: WZBroadcastAPI.Broadcaster
        This method is called on each broadcast component to begin a live streaming broadcast. Upon success, each component must set it's status to WZState.RUNNING or WZState.IDLE and indicate the error in the status as well
        Specified by:
        startBroadcasting in interface WZBroadcastAPI.Broadcaster
        Returns:
        The overall status after transitioning each broadcast component to WZState.RUNNING

      • stopBroadcasting

        public WZStatus stopBroadcasting()
        Description copied from interface: WZBroadcastAPI.Broadcaster
        This method is called on each broadcast component to end a live streaming broadcast. Upon success, each component must set it's status to WZState.IDLE
        Specified by:
        stopBroadcasting in interface WZBroadcastAPI.Broadcaster
        Returns:
        The overall status after transitioning each broadcast component to WZState.IDLE

      • getFrameSize

        public WZSize getFrameSize()
        Returns the currently configured video frame size
        Returns:
        The current frame size

      • getActiveFrameSize

        public WZSize getActiveFrameSize()
        Returns the active video frame size which may differ from the requested frame size if the current scale mode is FILL_VIEW
        Returns:
        The active video frame size

      • setFrameSize

        public WZSize setFrameSize(int width,
                           int height)
        Update the frame size for the active camera with the specified values

        Note that the actual frame size resulting from this operation may vary from the specified frame size. If the active camera device does not support the specified frame size, the closest, larger frame size that is supported will be selected instead and indicated as the return value from this method.

        Parameters:
        width - The width of the video frame size (pixels)
        height - The height of the video frame size (pixels)
        Returns:
        The actual frame size used, which may vary from the specified frame size depending on device support

      • setFrameSize

        public WZSize setFrameSize(WZSize frameSize)
        Update the frame size for the active camera with the specified size

        Note that the actual frame size resulting from this call may vary from the specified frame size. If the active camera device does not support the specified frame size, the closest, larger frame size that is supported will be selected instead and indicated as the return value from this method.

        Parameters:
        frameSize - The frame size specification
        Returns:
        The actual frame size selected, which may vary from the specified frame size depending on device support

      • getFramerate

        public int getFramerate()
        Returns the currently configured video framerate
        Returns:
        The current framerate

      • setFramerate

        public int setFramerate(int framerate)
        Update the framerate for the active camera with the specified value

        Note that the actual framerate resulting from this call may vary from the specified framerate. If the active camera device does not support the specified framerate, the closest supported framerate will be selected instead and indicated as the return value from this method.

        Parameters:
        framerate - The requested framerate (fps)
        Returns:
        The actual framerate selected, which may vary from the specified value depending on device support

        An array of camera instances

        public WZCamera getCamera()

        Returns:

      • switchCamera

        public WZCamera switchCamera()
        Changes the active camera being previewed to the alternate device camera, if available.

        In order to switch the active camera while streaming, the alternate camera must support the video frame size of the currently active camera.

      • isSwitchCameraAvailable

        public boolean isSwitchCameraAvailable(WZSize withFrameSize)
        Indicates if current camera can be switched based on the state of any live streaming broadcast currently active and device presence.

        In order to switch the active camera while streaming, the other camera must support the video frame size of the currently active camera.

        Parameters:
        withFrameSize - if supplied, the result will only be true if the other camera supported the specified frame size
        Returns:
        true if the active camera can be switched, false otherwise

      • isSwitchCameraAvailable

        public boolean isSwitchCameraAvailable(WZMediaConfig mediaConfig)
        Indicates if current camera can be switched based on the state of any live streaming broadcast currently active and device presence.

        In order to switch the active camera while streaming, the other camera must support the frane size of the currently active camera.

        Parameters:
        mediaConfig - if supplied, the result will only be true if the other camera supported the video frame size indicated by the specified configration
        Returns:
        true if the active camera can be switched, false otherwise

      • isSwitchCameraAvailable

        public boolean isSwitchCameraAvailable()
        Indicates if current camera can be switched based on the state of any live streaming broadcast currently active and device presence.

        In order to switch the active camera while streaming, the other camera must support the video frame size of the currently active camera.

        Returns:
        true if the active camera can be switched, false otherwise

      • onConfigurationChanged

        public void onConfigurationChanged(Configuration newConfig)
        Called when the device configuration changes, typically to detect device orientation changes
        Parameters:
        newConfig - The new device configuration. https://developer.android.com/reference/android/app/Activity.html#ConfigurationChanges

      • onLowMemory

        public void onLowMemory()
        Called when the overall system is running low on memory, and actively running processes should trim their memory usage. https://developer.android.com/reference/android/app/Activity.html#onLowMemory()

      • surfaceCreated

        public void surfaceCreated(SurfaceHolder surfaceHolder)
        Called immediately after the surface is first created. Implementations of this should start up whatever rendering code they desire. Note that only one thread can ever draw into a Surface, so you should not draw into the Surface here if your normal rendering will be in another thread.
        Parameters:
        surfaceHolder - The SurfaceHolder whose surface is being created.

      • surfaceChanged

        public void surfaceChanged(SurfaceHolder holder,
                           int format,
                           int width,
                           int height)
        Called immediately after any structural changes (format or size) have been made to the surface. You should at this point update the imagery in the surface. This method is always called at least once, after surfaceCreated(SurfaceHolder).
        Parameters:
        holder - The SurfaceHolder whose surface has changed.

      • surfaceDestroyed

        public void surfaceDestroyed(SurfaceHolder holder)
        Called immediately before a surface is being destroyed. After returning from this call, you should no longer try to access this surface. If you have a rendering thread that directly accesses the surface, you must ensure that thread is no longer touching the Surface before returning from this function.
        Parameters:
        holder - The SurfaceHolder whose surface is being destroyed.

      • onPause

        public void onPause()
        This method can be called from the activity's onPause() method to store the state of the camera preview display before the application is sent to the background. The stored state can then be restored with a corresponding call to onResume() made from the activity's onResume() method.

      • onResume

        public void onResume()
        This method can be used in conjunction with onPause() when called from the activity's onResume() method to restart the camera preview display based on the state it was in when the activity was paused and a corresponding call to onPause() was made.

      • getScreenSize

        public WZSize getScreenSize()
        Returns the size of camera preview display
        Returns:
        The size of camera preview display, in pixels

      • registerFrameRenderer

        public void registerFrameRenderer(WZRenderAPI.VideoFrameRenderer frameRenderer)
        Call to register an object instance implementing the WZRenderAPI.VideoFrameRenderer interface that can be used to render additional content, such as a logo, to the camera preview display
        Parameters:
        frameRenderer - An instance of a WZRenderAPI.VideoFrameRenderer implementation

      • unregisterFrameRenderer

        public void unregisterFrameRenderer(WZRenderAPI.VideoFrameRenderer frameRenderer)

        Parameters:
        frameRenderer - A previously registered instance of a WZRenderAPI.VideoFrameRenderer implementation
